```{=typst}\n#set page(numbering: none)\n```\n\n# Performance Benchmark Results

Performance comparison of different MTB-seq analysis methods showing runtime efficiency, memory usage, and accuracy metrics. All benchmarks were conducted on identical hardware with the same input datasets.\n\n```{=typst}\n\n// Performance-specific table functions with numeric formatting

#let performance-table(content) = {
  table(
    columns: 4,
    align: (left, right, right, right),
    stroke: (x, y) => (
      top: if y == 0 { 2pt } else if y == 1 { 1pt } else { 0.5pt },
      bottom: if y == 0 { 0pt } else { 0.5pt },
      left: 0pt,
      right: 0pt
    ),
    fill: (x, y) => if calc.even(y) and y > 0 { rgb("#f8f9fa") },
    ..content
  )
}\n\n```\n\n```{=typst}\n#bordered-table[\n  | *Method* | *Runtime (min)* | *Memory (GB)* | *Accuracy (%)* |\n  |---|---|---|---|\n  | MTB-seq v1.0 | 45 | 8.2 | 94.5 |\n  | MTB-seq v2.0 | 28 | 6.1 | 96.2 |\n  | Custom Pipeline | 67 | 12.5 | 93.8 |\n  | Reference Method | 89 | 15.3 | 92.1 |\n  | Optimized MTB-seq | 22 | 5.8 | 97.1 |\n]\n```\n
